lustre/ptlrpc/gss/gss_svc_upcall.c

00002  * Modifications for Lustre
00003  *
00004  * Copyright (c) 2007, 2010, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

00011 /*
00012  * Neil Brown <neilb@cse.unsw.edu.au>
00013  * J. Bruce Fields <bfields@umich.edu>
00014  * Andy Adamson <andros@umich.edu>
00015  * Dug Song <dugsong@monkey.org>
00016  *
00017  * RPCSEC_GSS server authentication.
00018  * This implements RPCSEC_GSS as defined in rfc2203 (rpcsec_gss) and rfc2078
00019  * (gssapi)
00020  *
00021  * The RPCSEC_GSS involves three stages:
00022  *  1/ context creation
00023  *  2/ data exchange
00024  *  3/ context destruction
00025  *
00026  * Context creation is handled largely by upcalls to user-space.
00027  *  In particular, GSS_Accept_sec_context is handled by an upcall
00028  * Data exchange is handled entirely within the kernel
00029  *  In particular, GSS_GetMIC, GSS_VerifyMIC, GSS_Seal, GSS_Unseal are in-kernel.
00030  * Context destruction is handled in-kernel
00031  *  GSS_Delete_sec_context is in-kernel
00032  *
00033  * Context creation is initiated by a RPCSEC_GSS_INIT request arriving.
00034  * The context handle and gss_token are used as a key into the rpcsec_init cache.
00035  * The content of this cache includes some of the outputs of GSS_Accept_sec_context,
00036  * being major_status, minor_status, context_handle, reply_token.
00037  * These are sent back to the client.
00038  * Sequence window management is handled by the kernel.  The window size if currently
00039  * a compile time constant.
00040  *
00041  * When user-space is happy that a context is established, it places an entry
00042  * in the rpcsec_context cache. The key for this cache is the context_handle.
00043  * The content includes:
00044  *   uid/gidlist - for determining access rights
00045  *   mechanism type
00046  *   mechanism specific information, such as a key
00047  *
00048  */
00049

00072 #define GSS_SVC_UPCALL_TIMEOUT  (20)
00073 
00074 static spinlock_t __ctx_index_lock;
00075 static __u64 __ctx_index;
00076 
00077 __u64 gss_get_next_ctx_index(void)
00078 {
00079         __u64 idx;
00080 
00081         spin_lock(&__ctx_index_lock);
00082         idx = __ctx_index++;
00083         spin_unlock(&__ctx_index_lock);
00084 
00085         return idx;
00086 }
00087 
00088 static inline unsigned long hash_mem(char *buf, int length, int bits)
00089 {
00090         unsigned long hash = 0;
00091         unsigned long l = 0;
00092         int len = 0;
00093         unsigned char c;
00094 
00095         do {
00096                 if (len == length) {
00097                         c = (char) len;
00098                         len = -1;
00099                 } else
00100                         c = *buf++;
00101 
00102                 l = (l << 8) | c;
00103                 len++;
00104 
00105                 if ((len & (BITS_PER_LONG/8-1)) == 0)
00106                         hash = hash_long(hash^l, BITS_PER_LONG);
00107         } while (len);
00108 
00109         return hash >> (BITS_PER_LONG - bits);
00110 }

00112 /* This compatibility can be removed once kernel 3.3 is used,
00113  * since cache_register_net/cache_unregister_net are exported.
00114  * Note that since kernel 3.4 cache_register and cache_unregister
00115  * are removed.
00116 */
00117 static inline int _cache_register_net(struct cache_detail *cd, struct net *net)
00118 {
00119 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_REGISTER
00120         return cache_register(cd);
00121 #else
00122         return cache_register_net(cd, net);
00123 #endif
00124 }
00125 static inline void _cache_unregister_net(struct cache_detail *cd,
00126                                          struct net *net)
00127 {
00128 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_REGISTER
00129         cache_unregister(cd);
00130 #else
00131         cache_unregister_net(cd, net);
00132 #endif
00133 }
00134 /****************************************
00135  * rsi cache                            *
00136  ****************************************/
00137 
00138 #define RSI_HASHBITS    (6)
00139 #define RSI_HASHMAX     (1 << RSI_HASHBITS)
00140 #define RSI_HASHMASK    (RSI_HASHMAX - 1)
00141 
00142 struct rsi {
00143         struct cache_head       h;
00144         __u32                   lustre_svc;
00145         __u64                   nid;
00146         wait_queue_head_t       waitq;
00147         rawobj_t                in_handle, in_token;
00148         rawobj_t                out_handle, out_token;
00149         int                     major_status, minor_status;
00150 };
00151 
00152 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00153 static struct hlist_head rsi_table[RSI_HASHMAX];
00154 #else
00155 static struct cache_head *rsi_table[RSI_HASHMAX];
00156 #endif
00157 static struct cache_detail rsi_cache;
00158 static struct rsi *rsi_update(struct rsi *new, struct rsi *old);
00159 static struct rsi *rsi_lookup(struct rsi *item);
00160 
00161 static inline int rsi_hash(struct rsi *item)
00162 {
00163         return hash_mem((char *)item->in_handle.data, item->in_handle.len,
00164                         RSI_HASHBITS) ^
00165                hash_mem((char *)item->in_token.data, item->in_token.len,
00166                         RSI_HASHBITS);
00167 }
00168 
00169 static inline int __rsi_match(struct rsi *item, struct rsi *tmp)
00170 {
00171         return (rawobj_equal(&item->in_handle, &tmp->in_handle) &&
00172                 rawobj_equal(&item->in_token, &tmp->in_token));
00173 }
00174 
00175 static void rsi_free(struct rsi *rsi)
00176 {
00177         rawobj_free(&rsi->in_handle);
00178         rawobj_free(&rsi->in_token);
00179         rawobj_free(&rsi->out_handle);
00180         rawobj_free(&rsi->out_token);
00181 }
00182 
00183 static void rsi_request(struct cache_detail *cd,
00184                         struct cache_head *h,
00185                         char **bpp, int *blen)
00186 {
00187         struct rsi *rsi = container_of(h, struct rsi, h);
00188         __u64 index = 0;
00189 
00190         /* if in_handle is null, provide kernel suggestion */
00191         if (rsi->in_handle.len == 0)
00192                 index = gss_get_next_ctx_index();
00193 
00194         qword_addhex(bpp, blen, (char *) &rsi->lustre_svc,
00195                         sizeof(rsi->lustre_svc));
00196         qword_addhex(bpp, blen, (char *) &rsi->nid, sizeof(rsi->nid));
00197         qword_addhex(bpp, blen, (char *) &index, sizeof(index));
00198         qword_addhex(bpp, blen, rsi->in_handle.data, rsi->in_handle.len);
00199         qword_addhex(bpp, blen, rsi->in_token.data, rsi->in_token.len);
00200         (*bpp)[-1] = '\n';
00201 }
00202 
00203 #ifdef HAVE_SUNRPC_UPCALL_HAS_3ARGS
00204 static int rsi_upcall(struct cache_detail *cd, struct cache_head *h)
00205 {
00206         return sunrpc_cache_pipe_upcall(cd, h, rsi_request);
00207 }
00208 #else
00209 
00210 static int rsi_upcall(struct cache_detail *cd, struct cache_head *h)
00211 {
00212         return sunrpc_cache_pipe_upcall(cd, h);
00213 }
00214 #endif
00215 
00216 static inline void __rsi_init(struct rsi *new, struct rsi *item)
00217 {
00218         new->out_handle = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00219         new->out_token = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00220 
00221         new->in_handle = item->in_handle;
00222         item->in_handle = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00223         new->in_token = item->in_token;
00224         item->in_token = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00225 
00226         new->lustre_svc = item->lustre_svc;
00227         new->nid = item->nid;
00228         init_waitqueue_head(&new->waitq);
00229 }
00230 
00231 static inline void __rsi_update(struct rsi *new, struct rsi *item)
00232 {
00233         LASSERT(new->out_handle.len == 0);
00234         LASSERT(new->out_token.len == 0);
00235 
00236         new->out_handle = item->out_handle;
00237         item->out_handle = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00238         new->out_token = item->out_token;
00239         item->out_token = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00240 
00241         new->major_status = item->major_status;
00242         new->minor_status = item->minor_status;
00243 }
00244 
00245 static void rsi_put(struct kref *ref)
00246 {
00247         struct rsi *rsi = container_of(ref, struct rsi, h.ref);
00248 
00249 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00250         LASSERT(rsi->h.cache_list.next == NULL);
00251 #else
00252         LASSERT(rsi->h.next == NULL);
00253 #endif
00254         rsi_free(rsi);
00255         OBD_FREE_PTR(rsi);
00256 }
00257 
00258 static int rsi_match(struct cache_head *a, struct cache_head *b)
00259 {
00260         struct rsi *item = container_of(a, struct rsi, h);
00261         struct rsi *tmp = container_of(b, struct rsi, h);
00262 
00263         return __rsi_match(item, tmp);
00264 }
00265 
00266 static void rsi_init(struct cache_head *cnew, struct cache_head *citem)
00267 {
00268         struct rsi *new = container_of(cnew, struct rsi, h);
00269         struct rsi *item = container_of(citem, struct rsi, h);
00270 
00271         __rsi_init(new, item);
00272 }
00273 
00274 static void update_rsi(struct cache_head *cnew, struct cache_head *citem)
00275 {
00276         struct rsi *new = container_of(cnew, struct rsi, h);
00277         struct rsi *item = container_of(citem, struct rsi, h);
00278 
00279         __rsi_update(new, item);
00280 }
00281 
00282 static struct cache_head *rsi_alloc(void)
00283 {
00284         struct rsi *rsi;
00285 
00286         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(rsi);
00287         if (rsi) 
00288                 return &rsi->h;
00289         else
00290                 return NULL;
00291 }
00292 
00293 static int rsi_parse(struct cache_detail *cd, char *mesg, int mlen)
00294 {
00295         char           *buf = mesg;
00296         char           *ep;
00297         int             len;
00298         struct rsi      rsii, *rsip = NULL;
00299         time_t          expiry;
00300         int             status = -EINVAL;
00301         ENTRY;
00302 
00303 
00304         memset(&rsii, 0, sizeof(rsii));
00305 
00306         /* handle */
00307         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00308         if (len < 0)
00309                 goto out;
00310         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsii.in_handle, buf, len)) {
00311                 status = -ENOMEM;
00312                 goto out;
00313         }
00314 
00315         /* token */
00316         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00317         if (len < 0)
00318                 goto out;
00319         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsii.in_token, buf, len)) {
00320                 status = -ENOMEM;
00321                 goto out;
00322         }
00323 
00324         rsip = rsi_lookup(&rsii);
00325         if (!rsip)
00326                 goto out;
00327 
00328         rsii.h.flags = 0;
00329         /* expiry */
00330         expiry = get_expiry(&mesg);
00331         if (expiry == 0)
00332                 goto out;
00333 
00334         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00335         if (len <= 0)
00336                 goto out;
00337 
00338         /* major */
00339         rsii.major_status = simple_strtol(buf, &ep, 10);
00340         if (*ep)
00341                 goto out;
00342 
00343         /* minor */
00344         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00345         if (len <= 0)
00346                 goto out;
00347         rsii.minor_status = simple_strtol(buf, &ep, 10);
00348         if (*ep)
00349                 goto out;
00350 
00351         /* out_handle */
00352         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00353         if (len < 0)
00354                 goto out;
00355         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsii.out_handle, buf, len)) {
00356                 status = -ENOMEM;
00357                 goto out;
00358         }
00359 
00360         /* out_token */
00361         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00362         if (len < 0)
00363                 goto out;
00364         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsii.out_token, buf, len)) {
00365                 status = -ENOMEM;
00366                 goto out;
00367         }
00368 
00369         rsii.h.expiry_time = expiry;
00370         rsip = rsi_update(&rsii, rsip);
00371         status = 0;
00372 out:
00373         rsi_free(&rsii);
00374         if (rsip) {
00375                 wake_up_all(&rsip->waitq);
00376                 cache_put(&rsip->h, &rsi_cache);
00377         } else {
00378                 status = -ENOMEM;
00379         }
00380 
00381         if (status)
00382                 CERROR("rsi parse error %d\n", status);
00383         RETURN(status);
00384 }
00385 
00386 static struct cache_detail rsi_cache = {
00387         .hash_size      = RSI_HASHMAX,
00388         .hash_table     = rsi_table,
00389         .name           = "auth.sptlrpc.init",
00390         .cache_put      = rsi_put,
00391 #ifndef HAVE_SUNRPC_UPCALL_HAS_3ARGS
00392         .cache_request  = rsi_request,
00393 #endif
00394         .cache_upcall   = rsi_upcall,
00395         .cache_parse    = rsi_parse,
00396         .match          = rsi_match,
00397         .init           = rsi_init,
00398         .update         = update_rsi,
00399         .alloc          = rsi_alloc,
00400 };
00401 
00402 static struct rsi *rsi_lookup(struct rsi *item)
00403 {
00404         struct cache_head *ch;
00405         int hash = rsi_hash(item);
00406 
00407         ch = sunrpc_cache_lookup(&rsi_cache, &item->h, hash);
00408         if (ch)
00409                 return container_of(ch, struct rsi, h);
00410         else
00411                 return NULL;
00412 }
00413 
00414 static struct rsi *rsi_update(struct rsi *new, struct rsi *old)
00415 {
00416         struct cache_head *ch;
00417         int hash = rsi_hash(new);
00418 
00419         ch = sunrpc_cache_update(&rsi_cache, &new->h, &old->h, hash);
00420         if (ch)
00421                 return container_of(ch, struct rsi, h);
00422         else
00423                 return NULL;
00424 }
00425 
00426 /****************************************
00427  * rsc cache                            *
00428  ****************************************/
00429 
00430 #define RSC_HASHBITS    (10)
00431 #define RSC_HASHMAX     (1 << RSC_HASHBITS)
00432 #define RSC_HASHMASK    (RSC_HASHMAX - 1)
00433 
00434 struct rsc {
00435         struct cache_head       h;
00436         struct obd_device      *target;
00437         rawobj_t                handle;
00438         struct gss_svc_ctx      ctx;
00439 };
00440 
00441 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00442 static struct hlist_head rsc_table[RSC_HASHMAX];
00443 #else
00444 static struct cache_head *rsc_table[RSC_HASHMAX];
00445 #endif
00446 static struct cache_detail rsc_cache;
00447 static struct rsc *rsc_update(struct rsc *new, struct rsc *old);
00448 static struct rsc *rsc_lookup(struct rsc *item);
00449 
00450 static void rsc_free(struct rsc *rsci)
00451 {
00452         rawobj_free(&rsci->handle);
00453         rawobj_free(&rsci->ctx.gsc_rvs_hdl);
00454         lgss_delete_sec_context(&rsci->ctx.gsc_mechctx);
00455 }
00456 
00457 static inline int rsc_hash(struct rsc *rsci)
00458 {
00459         return hash_mem((char *)rsci->handle.data,
00460                         rsci->handle.len, RSC_HASHBITS);
00461 }
00462 
00463 static inline int __rsc_match(struct rsc *new, struct rsc *tmp)
00464 {
00465         return rawobj_equal(&new->handle, &tmp->handle);
00466 }
00467 
00468 static inline void __rsc_init(struct rsc *new, struct rsc *tmp)
00469 {
00470         new->handle = tmp->handle;
00471         tmp->handle = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00472 
00473         new->target = NULL;
00474         memset(&new->ctx, 0, sizeof(new->ctx));
00475         new->ctx.gsc_rvs_hdl = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00476 }
00477 
00478 static inline void __rsc_update(struct rsc *new, struct rsc *tmp)
00479 {
00480         new->ctx = tmp->ctx;
00481         tmp->ctx.gsc_rvs_hdl = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00482         tmp->ctx.gsc_mechctx = NULL;
00483 
00484         memset(&new->ctx.gsc_seqdata, 0, sizeof(new->ctx.gsc_seqdata));
00485         spin_lock_init(&new->ctx.gsc_seqdata.ssd_lock);
00486 }
00487 
00488 static void rsc_put(struct kref *ref)
00489 {
00490         struct rsc *rsci = container_of(ref, struct rsc, h.ref);
00491 
00492 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00493         LASSERT(rsci->h.cache_list.next == NULL);
00494 #else
00495         LASSERT(rsci->h.next == NULL);
00496 #endif
00497         rsc_free(rsci);
00498         OBD_FREE_PTR(rsci);
00499 }
00500 
00501 static int rsc_match(struct cache_head *a, struct cache_head *b)
00502 {
00503         struct rsc *new = container_of(a, struct rsc, h);
00504         struct rsc *tmp = container_of(b, struct rsc, h);
00505 
00506         return __rsc_match(new, tmp);
00507 }
00508 
00509 static void rsc_init(struct cache_head *cnew, struct cache_head *ctmp)
00510 {
00511         struct rsc *new = container_of(cnew, struct rsc, h);
00512         struct rsc *tmp = container_of(ctmp, struct rsc, h);
00513 
00514         __rsc_init(new, tmp);
00515 }
00516 
00517 static void update_rsc(struct cache_head *cnew, struct cache_head *ctmp)
00518 {
00519         struct rsc *new = container_of(cnew, struct rsc, h);
00520         struct rsc *tmp = container_of(ctmp, struct rsc, h);
00521 
00522         __rsc_update(new, tmp);
00523 }
00524 
00525 static struct cache_head * rsc_alloc(void)
00526 {
00527         struct rsc *rsc;
00528 
00529         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(rsc);
00530         if (rsc)
00531                 return &rsc->h;
00532         else
00533                 return NULL;
00534 }
00535 
00536 static int rsc_parse(struct cache_detail *cd, char *mesg, int mlen)
00537 {
00538         char                *buf = mesg;
00539         int                  len, rv, tmp_int;
00540         struct rsc           rsci, *rscp = NULL;
00541         time_t               expiry;
00542         int                  status = -EINVAL;
00543         struct gss_api_mech *gm = NULL;
00544 
00545         memset(&rsci, 0, sizeof(rsci));
00546 
00547         /* context handle */
00548         len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00549         if (len < 0) goto out;
00550         status = -ENOMEM;
00551         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsci.handle, buf, len))
00552                 goto out;
00553 
00554         rsci.h.flags = 0;
00555         /* expiry */
00556         expiry = get_expiry(&mesg);
00557         status = -EINVAL;
00558         if (expiry == 0)
00559                 goto out;
00560 
00561         /* remote flag */
00562         rv = get_int(&mesg, &tmp_int);
00563         if (rv) {
00564                 CERROR("fail to get remote flag\n");
00565                 goto out;
00566         }
00567         rsci.ctx.gsc_remote = (tmp_int != 0);
00568 
00569         /* root user flag */
00570         rv = get_int(&mesg, &tmp_int);
00571         if (rv) {
00572                 CERROR("fail to get root user flag\n");
00573                 goto out;
00574         }
00575         rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_root = (tmp_int != 0);
00576 
00577         /* mds user flag */
00578         rv = get_int(&mesg, &tmp_int);
00579         if (rv) {
00580                 CERROR("fail to get mds user flag\n");
00581                 goto out;
00582         }
00583         rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_mds = (tmp_int != 0);
00584 
00585         /* oss user flag */
00586         rv = get_int(&mesg, &tmp_int);
00587         if (rv) {
00588                 CERROR("fail to get oss user flag\n");
00589                 goto out;
00590         }
00591         rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_oss = (tmp_int != 0);
00592 
00593         /* mapped uid */
00594         rv = get_int(&mesg, (int *) &rsci.ctx.gsc_mapped_uid);
00595         if (rv) {
00596                 CERROR("fail to get mapped uid\n");
00597                 goto out;
00598         }
00599 
00600         rscp = rsc_lookup(&rsci);
00601         if (!rscp)
00602                 goto out;
00603 
00604         /* uid, or NEGATIVE */
00605         rv = get_int(&mesg, (int *) &rsci.ctx.gsc_uid);
00606         if (rv == -EINVAL)
00607                 goto out;
00608         if (rv == -ENOENT) {
00609                 CERROR("NOENT? set rsc entry negative\n");
00610                 set_bit(CACHE_NEGATIVE, &rsci.h.flags);
00611         } else {
00612                 rawobj_t tmp_buf;
00613                 unsigned long ctx_expiry;
00614 
00615                 /* gid */
00616                 if (get_int(&mesg, (int *) &rsci.ctx.gsc_gid))
00617                         goto out;
00618 
00619                 /* mech name */
00620                 len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00621                 if (len < 0)
00622                         goto out;
00623                 gm = lgss_name_to_mech(buf);
00624                 status = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00625                 if (!gm)
00626                         goto out;
00627 
00628                 status = -EINVAL;
00629                 /* mech-specific data: */
00630                 len = qword_get(&mesg, buf, mlen);
00631                 if (len < 0)
00632                         goto out;
00633 
00634                 tmp_buf.len = len;
00635                 tmp_buf.data = (unsigned char *)buf;
00636                 if (lgss_import_sec_context(&tmp_buf, gm,
00637                                             &rsci.ctx.gsc_mechctx))
00638                         goto out;
00639 
00640                 /* currently the expiry time passed down from user-space
00641                  * is invalid, here we retrive it from mech. */
00642                 if (lgss_inquire_context(rsci.ctx.gsc_mechctx, &ctx_expiry)) {
00643                         CERROR("unable to get expire time, drop it\n");
00644                         goto out;
00645                 }
00646                 expiry = (time_t) ctx_expiry;
00647         }
00648 
00649         rsci.h.expiry_time = expiry;
00650         rscp = rsc_update(&rsci, rscp);
00651         status = 0;
00652 out:
00653         if (gm)
00654                 lgss_mech_put(gm);
00655         rsc_free(&rsci);
00656         if (rscp)
00657                 cache_put(&rscp->h, &rsc_cache);
00658         else
00659                 status = -ENOMEM;
00660 
00661         if (status)
00662                 CERROR("parse rsc error %d\n", status);
00663         return status;
00664 }
00665 
00666 static struct cache_detail rsc_cache = {
00667         .hash_size      = RSC_HASHMAX,
00668         .hash_table     = rsc_table,
00669         .name           = "auth.sptlrpc.context",
00670         .cache_put      = rsc_put,
00671         .cache_parse    = rsc_parse,
00672         .match          = rsc_match,
00673         .init           = rsc_init,
00674         .update         = update_rsc,
00675         .alloc          = rsc_alloc,
00676 };
00677 
00678 static struct rsc *rsc_lookup(struct rsc *item)
00679 {
00680         struct cache_head *ch;
00681         int                hash = rsc_hash(item);
00682 
00683         ch = sunrpc_cache_lookup(&rsc_cache, &item->h, hash);
00684         if (ch)
00685                 return container_of(ch, struct rsc, h);
00686         else
00687                 return NULL;
00688 }
00689 
00690 static struct rsc *rsc_update(struct rsc *new, struct rsc *old)
00691 {
00692         struct cache_head *ch;
00693         int                hash = rsc_hash(new);
00694 
00695         ch = sunrpc_cache_update(&rsc_cache, &new->h, &old->h, hash);
00696         if (ch)
00697                 return container_of(ch, struct rsc, h);
00698         else
00699                 return NULL;
00700 }
00701 
00702 #define COMPAT_RSC_PUT(item, cd)        cache_put((item), (cd))
00703 
00704 /****************************************
00705  * rsc cache flush                      *
00706  ****************************************/
00707 
00708 typedef int rsc_entry_match(struct rsc *rscp, long data);
00709 
00710 static void rsc_flush(rsc_entry_match *match, long data)
00711 {
00712 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00713         struct cache_head *ch = NULL;
00714         struct hlist_head *head;
00715 #else
00716         struct cache_head **ch;
00717 #endif
00718         struct rsc *rscp;
00719         int n;
00720         ENTRY;
00721 
00722         write_lock(&rsc_cache.hash_lock);
00723         for (n = 0; n < RSC_HASHMAX; n++) {
00724 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00725                 head = &rsc_cache.hash_table[n];
00726                 hlist_for_each_entry(ch, head, cache_list) {
00727                         rscp = container_of(ch, struct rsc, h);
00728 #else
00729                 for (ch = &rsc_cache.hash_table[n]; *ch;) {
00730                         rscp = container_of(*ch, struct rsc, h);
00731 #endif
00732 
00733                         if (!match(rscp, data)) {
00734 #ifndef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00735                                 ch = &((*ch)->next);
00736 #endif
00737                                 continue;
00738                         }
00739 
00740                         /* it seems simply set NEGATIVE doesn't work */
00741 #ifdef HAVE_CACHE_HEAD_HLIST
00742                         hlist_del_init(&ch->cache_list);
00743 #else
00744                         *ch = (*ch)->next;
00745                         rscp->h.next = NULL;
00746 #endif
00747                         cache_get(&rscp->h);
00748                         set_bit(CACHE_NEGATIVE, &rscp->h.flags);
00749                         COMPAT_RSC_PUT(&rscp->h, &rsc_cache);
00750                         rsc_cache.entries--;
00751                 }
00752         }
00753         write_unlock(&rsc_cache.hash_lock);
00754         EXIT;
00755 }
00756 
00757 static int match_uid(struct rsc *rscp, long uid)
00758 {
00759         if ((int) uid == -1)
00760                 return 1;
00761         return ((int) rscp->ctx.gsc_uid == (int) uid);
00762 }
00763 
00764 static int match_target(struct rsc *rscp, long target)
00765 {
00766         return (rscp->target == (struct obd_device *) target);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static inline void rsc_flush_uid(int uid)
00770 {
00771         if (uid == -1)
00772                 CWARN("flush all gss contexts...\n");
00773 
00774         rsc_flush(match_uid, (long) uid);
00775 }
00776 
00777 static inline void rsc_flush_target(struct obd_device *target)
00778 {
00779         rsc_flush(match_target, (long) target);
00780 }
00781 
00782 void gss_secsvc_flush(struct obd_device *target)
00783 {
00784         rsc_flush_target(target);
00785 }
00786 
00787 static struct rsc *gss_svc_searchbyctx(rawobj_t *handle)
00788 {
00789         struct rsc  rsci;
00790         struct rsc *found;
00791 
00792         memset(&rsci, 0, sizeof(rsci));
00793         if (rawobj_dup(&rsci.handle, handle))
00794                 return NULL;
00795 
00796         found = rsc_lookup(&rsci);
00797         rsc_free(&rsci);
00798         if (!found)
00799                 return NULL;
00800         if (cache_check(&rsc_cache, &found->h, NULL))
00801                 return NULL;
00802         return found;
00803 }
00804 
00805 int gss_svc_upcall_install_rvs_ctx(struct obd_import *imp,
00806                                    struct gss_sec *gsec,
00807                                    struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx)
00808 {
00809         struct rsc      rsci, *rscp = NULL;
00810         unsigned long   ctx_expiry;
00811         __u32           major;
00812         int             rc;
00813         ENTRY;
00814 
00815         memset(&rsci, 0, sizeof(rsci));
00816 
00817         if (rawobj_alloc(&rsci.handle, (char *) &gsec->gs_rvs_hdl,
00818                          sizeof(gsec->gs_rvs_hdl)))
00819                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00820 
00821         rscp = rsc_lookup(&rsci);
00822         if (rscp == NULL)
00823                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00824 
00825         major = lgss_copy_reverse_context(gctx->gc_mechctx,
00826                                           &rsci.ctx.gsc_mechctx);
00827         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00828                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00829 
00830         if (lgss_inquire_context(rsci.ctx.gsc_mechctx, &ctx_expiry)) {
00831                 CERROR("unable to get expire time, drop it\n");
00832                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00833         }
00834         rsci.h.expiry_time = (time_t) ctx_expiry;
00835 
00836         if (strcmp(imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) == 0)
00837                 rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_mds = 1;
00838         else if (strcmp(imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) == 0)
00839                 rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_oss = 1;
00840         else
00841                 rsci.ctx.gsc_usr_root = 1;
00842 
00843         rscp = rsc_update(&rsci, rscp);
00844         if (rscp == NULL)
00845                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00846 
00847         rscp->target = imp->imp_obd;
00848         rawobj_dup(&gctx->gc_svc_handle, &rscp->handle);
00849 
00850         CWARN("create reverse svc ctx %p to %s: idx "LPX64"\n",
00851               &rscp->ctx, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), gsec->gs_rvs_hdl);
00852         rc = 0;
00853 out:
00854         if (rscp)
00855                 cache_put(&rscp->h, &rsc_cache);
00856         rsc_free(&rsci);
00857 
00858         if (rc)
00859                 CERROR("create reverse svc ctx: idx "LPX64", rc %d\n",
00860                        gsec->gs_rvs_hdl, rc);
00861         RETURN(rc);
00862 }
00863 
00864 int gss_svc_upcall_expire_rvs_ctx(rawobj_t *handle)
00865 {
00866         const cfs_time_t        expire = 20;
00867         struct rsc             *rscp;
00868 
00869         rscp = gss_svc_searchbyctx(handle);
00870         if (rscp) {
00871                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "reverse svcctx %p (rsc %p) expire soon\n",
00872                        &rscp->ctx, rscp);
00873 
00874                 rscp->h.expiry_time = cfs_time_current_sec() + expire;
00875                 COMPAT_RSC_PUT(&rscp->h, &rsc_cache);
00876         }
00877         return 0;
00878 }
00879 
00880 int gss_svc_upcall_dup_handle(rawobj_t *handle, struct gss_svc_ctx *ctx)
00881 {
00882         struct rsc *rscp = container_of(ctx, struct rsc, ctx);
00883 
00884         return rawobj_dup(handle, &rscp->handle);
00885 }
00886 
00887 int gss_svc_upcall_update_sequence(rawobj_t *handle, __u32 seq)
00888 {
00889         struct rsc             *rscp;
00890 
00891         rscp = gss_svc_searchbyctx(handle);
00892         if (rscp) {
00893                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "reverse svcctx %p (rsc %p) update seq to %u\n",
00894                        &rscp->ctx, rscp, seq + 1);
00895 
00896                 rscp->ctx.gsc_rvs_seq = seq + 1;
00897                 COMPAT_RSC_PUT(&rscp->h, &rsc_cache);
00898         }
00899         return 0;
00900 }
00901 
00902 static struct cache_deferred_req* cache_upcall_defer(struct cache_req *req)
00903 {
00904         return NULL;
00905 }
00906 static struct cache_req cache_upcall_chandle = { cache_upcall_defer };
00907 
00908 int gss_svc_upcall_handle_init(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00909                                struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx,
00910                                struct gss_wire_ctx *gw,
00911                                struct obd_device *target,
00912                                __u32 lustre_svc,
00913                                rawobj_t *rvs_hdl,
00914                                rawobj_t *in_token)
00915 {
00916         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs;
00917         struct rsc                *rsci = NULL;
00918         struct rsi                *rsip = NULL, rsikey;
00919         wait_queue_t             wait;
00920         int                        replen = sizeof(struct ptlrpc_body);
00921         struct gss_rep_header     *rephdr;
00922         int                        first_check = 1;
00923         int                        rc = SECSVC_DROP;
00924         ENTRY;
00925 
00926         memset(&rsikey, 0, sizeof(rsikey));
00927         rsikey.lustre_svc = lustre_svc;
00928         rsikey.nid = (__u64) req->rq_peer.nid;
00929 
00930         /* duplicate context handle. for INIT it always 0 */
00931         if (rawobj_dup(&rsikey.in_handle, &gw->gw_handle)) {
00932                 CERROR("fail to dup context handle\n");
00933                 GOTO(out, rc);
00934         }
00935 
00936         if (rawobj_dup(&rsikey.in_token, in_token)) {
00937                 CERROR("can't duplicate token\n");
00938                 rawobj_free(&rsikey.in_handle);
00939                 GOTO(out, rc);
00940         }
00941 
00942         rsip = rsi_lookup(&rsikey);
00943         rsi_free(&rsikey);
00944         if (!rsip) {
00945                 CERROR("error in rsi_lookup.\n");
00946 
00947                 if (!gss_pack_err_notify(req, GSS_S_FAILURE, 0))
00948                         rc = SECSVC_COMPLETE;
00949 
00950                 GOTO(out, rc);
00951         }
00952 
00953         cache_get(&rsip->h); /* take an extra ref */
00954         init_waitqueue_head(&rsip->waitq);
00955         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
00956         add_wait_queue(&rsip->waitq, &wait);
00957 
00958 cache_check:
00959         /* Note each time cache_check() will drop a reference if return
00960          * non-zero. We hold an extra reference on initial rsip, but must
00961          * take care of following calls. */
00962         rc = cache_check(&rsi_cache, &rsip->h, &cache_upcall_chandle);
00963         switch (rc) {
00964         case -ETIMEDOUT:
00965         case -EAGAIN: {
00966                 int valid;
00967 
00968                 if (first_check) {
00969                         first_check = 0;
00970 
00971                         read_lock(&rsi_cache.hash_lock);
00972                         valid = test_bit(CACHE_VALID, &rsip->h.flags);
00973                         if (valid == 0)
00974                                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00975                         read_unlock(&rsi_cache.hash_lock);
00976 
00977                         if (valid == 0) {
00978                                 unsigned long jiffies;
00979                                 jiffies = msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC *
00980                                           GSS_SVC_UPCALL_TIMEOUT);
00981                                 schedule_timeout(jiffies);
00982                         }
00983                         cache_get(&rsip->h);
00984                         goto cache_check;
00985                 }
00986                 CWARN("waited %ds timeout, drop\n", GSS_SVC_UPCALL_TIMEOUT);
00987                 break;
00988         }
00989         case -ENOENT:
00990                 CWARN("cache_check return ENOENT, drop\n");
00991                 break;
00992         case 0:
00993                 /* if not the first check, we have to release the extra
00994                  * reference we just added on it. */
00995                 if (!first_check)
00996                         cache_put(&rsip->h, &rsi_cache);
00997                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "cache_check is good\n");
00998                 break;
00999         }
01000 
01001         remove_wait_queue(&rsip->waitq, &wait);
01002         cache_put(&rsip->h, &rsi_cache);
01003 
01004         if (rc)
01005                 GOTO(out, rc = SECSVC_DROP);
01006 
01007         rc = SECSVC_DROP;
01008         rsci = gss_svc_searchbyctx(&rsip->out_handle);
01009         if (!rsci) {
01010                 CERROR("authentication failed\n");
01011 
01012                 if (!gss_pack_err_notify(req, GSS_S_FAILURE, 0))
01013                         rc = SECSVC_COMPLETE;
01014 
01015                 GOTO(out, rc);
01016         } else {
01017                 cache_get(&rsci->h);
01018                 grctx->src_ctx = &rsci->ctx;
01019         }
01020 
01021         if (rawobj_dup(&rsci->ctx.gsc_rvs_hdl, rvs_hdl)) {
01022                 CERROR("failed duplicate reverse handle\n");
01023                 GOTO(out, rc);
01024         }
01025 
01026         rsci->target = target;
01027 
01028         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "server create rsc %p(%u->%s)\n",
01029                rsci, rsci->ctx.gsc_uid, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01030 
01031         if (rsip->out_handle.len > PTLRPC_GSS_MAX_HANDLE_SIZE) {
01032                 CERROR("handle size %u too large\n", rsip->out_handle.len);
01033                 GOTO(out, rc = SECSVC_DROP);
01034         }
01035 
01036         grctx->src_init = 1;
01037         grctx->src_reserve_len = cfs_size_round4(rsip->out_token.len);
01038 
01039         rc = lustre_pack_reply_v2(req, 1, &replen, NULL, 0);
01040         if (rc) {
01041                 CERROR("failed to pack reply: %d\n", rc);
01042                 GOTO(out, rc = SECSVC_DROP);
01043         }
01044 
01045         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
01046         LASSERT(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_bufcount == 3);
01047         LASSERT(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens[0] >=
01048                 sizeof(*rephdr) + rsip->out_handle.len);
01049         LASSERT(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens[2] >= rsip->out_token.len);
01050 
01051         rephdr = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 0, 0);
01052         rephdr->gh_version = PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION;
01053         rephdr->gh_flags = 0;
01054         rephdr->gh_proc = PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR;
01055         rephdr->gh_major = rsip->major_status;
01056         rephdr->gh_minor = rsip->minor_status;
01057         rephdr->gh_seqwin = GSS_SEQ_WIN;
01058         rephdr->gh_handle.len = rsip->out_handle.len;
01059         memcpy(rephdr->gh_handle.data, rsip->out_handle.data,
01060                rsip->out_handle.len);
01061 
01062         memcpy(lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 2, 0), rsip->out_token.data,
01063                rsip->out_token.len);
01064 
01065         rs->rs_repdata_len = lustre_shrink_msg(rs->rs_repbuf, 2,
01066                                                rsip->out_token.len, 0);
01067 
01068         rc = SECSVC_OK;
01069 
01070 out:
01071         /* it looks like here we should put rsip also, but this mess up
01072          * with NFS cache mgmt code... FIXME */
01073 #if 0
01074         if (rsip)
01075                 rsi_put(&rsip->h, &rsi_cache);
01076 #endif
01077 
01078         if (rsci) {
01079                 /* if anything went wrong, we don't keep the context too */
01080                 if (rc != SECSVC_OK)
01081                         set_bit(CACHE_NEGATIVE, &rsci->h.flags);
01082                 else
01083                         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "create rsc with idx "LPX64"\n",
01084                                gss_handle_to_u64(&rsci->handle));
01085 
01086                 COMPAT_RSC_PUT(&rsci->h, &rsc_cache);
01087         }
01088         RETURN(rc);
01089 }
01090 
01091 struct gss_svc_ctx *gss_svc_upcall_get_ctx(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01092                                            struct gss_wire_ctx *gw)
01093 {
01094         struct rsc *rsc;
01095 
01096         rsc = gss_svc_searchbyctx(&gw->gw_handle);
01097         if (!rsc) {
01098                 CWARN("Invalid gss ctx idx "LPX64" from %s\n",
01099                       gss_handle_to_u64(&gw->gw_handle),
01100                       libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01101                 return NULL;
01102         }
01103 
01104         return &rsc->ctx;
01105 }
01106 
01107 void gss_svc_upcall_put_ctx(struct gss_svc_ctx *ctx)
01108 {
01109         struct rsc *rsc = container_of(ctx, struct rsc, ctx);
01110 
01111         COMPAT_RSC_PUT(&rsc->h, &rsc_cache);
01112 }
01113 
01114 void gss_svc_upcall_destroy_ctx(struct gss_svc_ctx *ctx)
01115 {
01116         struct rsc *rsc = container_of(ctx, struct rsc, ctx);
01117 
01118         /* can't be found */
01119         set_bit(CACHE_NEGATIVE, &rsc->h.flags);
01120         /* to be removed at next scan */
01121         rsc->h.expiry_time = 1;
01122 }
01123 
01124 int __init gss_init_svc_upcall(void)
01125 {
01126         int     i, rc;
01127 
01128         spin_lock_init(&__ctx_index_lock);
01129         /*
01130          * this helps reducing context index confliction. after server reboot,
01131          * conflicting request from clients might be filtered out by initial
01132          * sequence number checking, thus no chance to sent error notification
01133          * back to clients.
01134          */
01135         cfs_get_random_bytes(&__ctx_index, sizeof(__ctx_index));
01136 
01137         rc = _cache_register_net(&rsi_cache, &init_net);
01138         if (rc != 0)
01139                 return rc;
01140 
01141         rc = _cache_register_net(&rsc_cache, &init_net);
01142         if (rc != 0) {
01143                 _cache_unregister_net(&rsi_cache, &init_net);
01144                 return rc;
01145         }
01146 
01147         /* FIXME this looks stupid. we intend to give lsvcgssd a chance to open
01148          * the init upcall channel, otherwise there's big chance that the first
01149          * upcall issued before the channel be opened thus nfsv4 cache code will
01150          * drop the request direclty, thus lead to unnecessary recovery time.
01151          * here we wait at miximum 1.5 seconds. */
01152         for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
01153                 if (atomic_read(&rsi_cache.readers) > 0)
01154                         break;
01155                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
01156                 LASSERT(msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC) >= 4);
01157                 schedule_timeout(msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC / 4));
01158         }
01159 
01160         if (atomic_read(&rsi_cache.readers) == 0)
01161                 CWARN("Init channel is not opened by lsvcgssd, following "
01162                       "request might be dropped until lsvcgssd is active\n");
01163 
01164         return 0;
01165 }
01166 
01167 void gss_exit_svc_upcall(void)
01168 {
01169         cache_purge(&rsi_cache);
01170         _cache_unregister_net(&rsi_cache, &init_net);
01171 
01172         cache_purge(&rsc_cache);
01173         _cache_unregister_net(&rsc_cache, &init_net);
01174 }
